Calculate Reynolds Number

Source: R/energybalance_functions.R
Reynolds_number.Rd

estimate the Reynolds Number, which describes the dynamic properties of the fluid surrounding the animal as the ratio of internal viscous forces (Gates 1980 Biophysical Ecology).

Reynolds_number(u, D, nu)

Arguments

u

is wind speed in m/s

D

is characteristic dimension (e.g., body diameter) (m)

nu

is the kinematic viscosity, ratio of dynamic viscosity to density of the fluid (m^2 s^(-1)), can calculate from DRYAIR or WETAIR

Value

Reynolds number

See also

Other biophysical models: Free_or_forced_convection(), Grashof_number_Gates(), Grashof_number(), Nu_from_Gr(), Nu_from_Re(), Nusselt_number(), Prandtl_number(), Qconduction_animal(), Qconduction_substrate(), Qconvection(), Qemitted_thermal_radiation(), Qevaporation(), Qmetabolism_from_mass_temp(), Qmetabolism_from_mass(), Qnet_Gates(), Qradiation_absorbed(), Qthermal_radiation_absorbed(), Tb_CampbellNorman(), Tb_Fei(), Tb_Gates2(), Tb_Gates(), Tb_butterfly(), Tb_grasshopper(), Tb_limpetBH(), Tb_limpet(), Tb_lizard(), Tb_mussel(), Tb_salamander_humid(), Tb_snail(), Tbed_mussel(), Tsoil(), actual_vapor_pressure(), boundary_layer_resistance(), external_resistance_to_water_vapor_transfer(), heat_transfer_coefficient_approximation(), heat_transfer_coefficient_simple(), heat_transfer_coefficient(), saturation_vapor_pressure(), saturation_water_vapor_pressure()

Examples

Reynolds_number(u=1, D=0.001, nu=1.2)
#> [1] 0.0008333333
